general:
Thrive Messenger Help

Thrive Messenger supports multi-server chat, accessible keyboard workflows, and admin tooling from one client. Press F1 in any window for context help. Press Escape or Command+W to close help and return.

Use the menu bar or context menus for all major actions: contacts, chats, file transfers, server management, bot rules, and updates.
login:
Login and Server Selection

Choose a server from the Server list, then enter username and password to sign in. Use Manage Servers to add, edit, remove, and set a primary server entry.

Auto-login uses saved credentials and the selected server profile. If login fails, confirm server host/port/TLS values in Administration settings.
main:
Contacts Window

The main window provides contacts, search, status controls, user directory, server info, server manager, settings, and updates. Context menus and menu actions mirror button actions for keyboard-first use.

  • Start Chat: Return or menu action
  • Send File: Alt+F or menu action
  • User Directory: browse and filter users across configured servers
  • File Transfers: view sent/received files and saved locations
chat:
Chat Window

Default key behavior is Enter to send, Command+Enter for new line, and Control+Enter to send a file. Enter action can be changed in Settings.

Chat history is keyboard-navigable and can be logged based on global and per-contact rules. Typing indicators and message readout are configurable for accessibility.
directory:
User Directory

Directory shows Everyone, Online, Offline, and Admins tabs with sort/filter options and server labels. Duplicate usernames across servers are displayed as separate entries.

If cross-server directory messaging is enabled in Administration settings, you can start a direct message to users on configured remote servers. When duplicates exist, the client lets you choose the target server user and remembers that default until you choose another.
admin:
Administration

Server Side Commands supports command-based administration such as alerts, account actions, and scheduled restart. Command responses are stored in an accessible history list for arrow-key review.

Administration also provides bot rules management and server/update configuration. Unauthorized actions return explicit server-side errors.
settings:
Settings

Settings are split into General, Audio, and Administration tabs. Configure sound packs, volume, accessibility behavior, chat key behavior, and layout preferences.

Administration settings include server host/port/TLS, update feed/repo fallback, restart scheduling, and toggle for cross-server directory direct messaging.
server_info:
Server Info

Server Info reports active server name, host, port, encryption state, online users/admins, uptime, and file policy limits.

Use this view for quick diagnostics to confirm the active connection and server policy before troubleshooting.
bot_rules:
Bot Rules Manager

Bot Rules Manager supports load, edit, save, and reset per bot. Global baseline rules can come from an agent ZIP/file ruleset, and admin overrides are stored per admin scope.

Admins can edit and reset rules. Non-admin users can request and view active rules in read-only mode.
